intro: Pauridia glabella var. leptantha, commonly known as the slender-leaved paurdia, is a rare and lesser-known species within the Apocynaceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant is native to specific regions in South America, particularly in the Andean foothills, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
